Uses of Class
chess.Chess.Piece

    • Uses of Chess.Piece in chess

      Subclasses of Chess.Piece in chess 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Chess.Bishop
      The Bishop class acts like a bishop in any chess game.
      static class  Chess.Black_Pawn
      White_Pawn and Black_Pawns are the only cases where there are separate classes for the same type of piece since pawns can only advance while other pieces may move in any direction.
      static class  Chess.King
      Rook class and King class are the only Pieces to have an additional field to other Pieces.
      static class  Chess.Knight
      The Knight class acts like a knight in any chess game.
      static class  Chess.Queen
      The Queen class acts like a queen in any chess game.
      static class  Chess.Rook
      Rook class and King class are the only Pieces to have an additional field to other Pieces.
      static class  Chess.White_Pawn
      White_Pawn and Black_Pawns are the only cases where there are separate classes for the same type of piece since pawns can only advance while other pieces may move in any direction.
      Fields in chess declared as Chess.Piece 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Chess.Piece[][] Chess.board
      Board is the data structure that we will be using.
      Methods in chess that return Chess.Piece 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Chess.Piece[][] Chess.copyBoard()

      Methods in chess with parameters of type Chess.Piece 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract boolean Chess.Piece.check(Chess.Piece[][] board)
      check checks the positions in the inputed board that this piece can capture in to see if the opponent side's King is there.

      static void Chess.checkForCheck(Chess.Piece[][] board)
      checkForCheck runs through the entire board and finds all pieces of the side playing and sees if they are currently checking the opponent's King.
      static void Chess.display(Chess.Piece[][] board)
      display prints out the board given by the parameter.
      static boolean Chess.putsOwnKingInCheck(Chess.Piece[][] board_copy)
      putsOwnKingInCheck checks to see if the current side playing, indicated by the global variable white_moves, is in check.
